extendedInfo.description: Easily time labor contractions with a handy one-button interface.Shows the last hour (to decide when to go to the hospital) and 20 minutes (to see if they're increasing relative to the hour).Remembers all data so you can jump back and forth to your favorite game during and between contractions.  Welcome Baby!Now with a page listing contraction history.  Push "Menu" to access the history as well as undo the last toggle and reset data.This is the "Lite" version of my Labor and Contraction Timer app, which has advertisements.  It is not otherwise limited in any way (you can time an unlimited number of contractions over an unlimited amount of time.)  There is now a paid version of this app which removes the advertisement if you're so inclined, thanks!

reviews.title: looks the best
reviews.comment: functions the same as all the others i\'m looking at, however this one has a large noticeable start/stop button, and a way to check duration relative to another time to check for advancement.
reviews.author: Skyler Zio

reviews.title: Worked great for our first child.
reviews.comment: The large button and simple yet pleasant GUI made it easy and enjoyable to use.
reviews.author: Bobby Lydon-Lam

reviews.title: Exactly What We Needed
reviews.comment: This was perfect for helping us track contractions while I was in labor.  The large start/stop button meant that even my mom could use the app accurately.  We especially found the calculations of the durations for the past 20 minutes and past hour to be very helpful as it gave us an easy way to determine how things were progressing.  It was also great to be able to skim back through the history of all the contractions.  It was so much easier to give good information to the midwives to help them know when to arrive.  Thank you, thank you, thank you!  We have a healthy, lovely baby girl, born at home at 9 lb, 5 oz, and monitoring labor was definitely easier with this app.
reviews.author: Jenn Anne

reviews.title: Excellent app!
reviews.comment: Giant green button that starts, giant red button that stops. History keeps track of all the contractions you\'ve had and length of each one. If history would also tell you time between, it would be perfect!
reviews.author: Sandy Salazar

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Worked like it\'s should. Very helpful when was in labor.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.comment: This app worked wonderfully! The nurses at the hospital found the history very helpful!
reviews.author: A Google User
